Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.morozov.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.morozov.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements Impler, JarImpler
This class implements Impler and JarImpler using reflection. This class can be used to generate implementation for other classes or interfaces that can be implemented. Implementation can be saved as `.java` or `.jar` file.
See Also:
  • Impler
  • JarImpler

  • Method Details

    • createFunctionHeader

      private String createFunctionHeader(String modifiersAndReturnValue, String name, Parameter[] parameters, Class<?>[] exceptions)
      Returns a header of function, constructor or method with given name, modifiers, parameters, returning value and thrown exceptions. Header ends with "{".
      Parameters:
      modifiersAndReturnValue - A string contained modifiers and return value separated by whitespaces
      name - A name of function/method/constructor
      parameters - Parameters of function/method/constructor.
      exceptions - Exceptions that can be thrown
      Returns:
      A string representing the header of function/method/constructor

    • createMethodHeader

      private String createMethodHeader(Method method)
      Creates a header of method method with given modifiers, name and signature. This method invokes createFunctionHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.reflect.Parameter[], java.lang.Class<?>[]) with parameters derived from .
      Parameters:
      method - The method that has to be created.
      Returns:
      A string representing the method's header.

    • createFunction

      private String createFunction(String header, String body)
      Creates a method/constructor/function depending on header and body of function. This method combines strings and inserts the necessary tabs and line separators.
      Parameters:
      header - header of method/constructor/function. For example, "public void foo(int x) throws IOException {"
      body - body of method/constructor/function.
      Returns:
      A string representing java code of method/constructor/function

    • createConstructorHeader

      private String createConstructorHeader(Constructor<?> constructor)
      Creates a header of constructor constructor with given modifiers and signature. This method invokes createFunctionHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.reflect.Parameter[], java.lang.Class<?>[]) with parameters derived from .
      Parameters:
      constructor - The constructor that has to be created.
      Returns:
      A string representing the constructor's header.

    • createConstructorBody

      private String createConstructorBody(Constructor<?> constructor)
      Creates body of constructor that call's the parent constructor with parameters given by Executable.getParameters().
      Parameters:
      constructor - The constructor that has to be created.
      Returns:
      A body of constructor with signature given by Executable.getParameters().

    • createReturnValue

      private String createReturnValue(Class<?> token)
      Returns a string in the form "return T;", where T depends on the provided token. T is: "" for void, "false" for Boolean or bool, "0" for other primitives, "null" for reference types.
      Parameters:
      token - The type of the function's return value, used to determine the default return value.
      Returns:
      A string representing the return statement.

    • generateImplementation

      private String generateImplementation(Class<?> token) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Creates a class that implements or extends the specified token.
      Parameters:
      token - The class or interface for which an implementation or extension is to be generated.
      Returns:
      A string representing the Java code of a class that implements or extends the specified token.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If an error occurs while generating the implementation of the class or interface.

    • getPathToFile

      Path getPathToFile(Class<?> token, Path root)
      Returns the path to the `.java` file that contains the implementation of the specified token.
      Parameters:
      token - The class or interface that needs to be implemented.
      root - Root directory of package.
      Returns:
      The path to the `.java` file that implements token.

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: Impler
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • compile

      private void compile(Class<?> token, Path file) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Compiles the source `.java` file at the given path file to a class file.
      Parameters:
      token - The class or interface that is being implemented.
      file - The path to the `.java` source file that contains the implementation of the class or interface.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If an error occurs while compiling the source file into a class file.

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: JarImpler
      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      jarFile - target .jar file.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Creates a `.jar` or `.java` file with the implementation of the given class or interface and places it at the specified path.

      The method can create either a `.jar` file or a `.java` file, depending on the provided arguments.

      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments:
      • First: "-jar" if a `.jar` file should be created, otherwise leave empty for a `.java` file.
      • Second: The name of the class or interface to implement.
      • Third: The path where the implementation file should be placed. Use the root directory for a `.java` file, or specify the desired path for a `.jar` file.
